channel.title: Team on LABHDUFRJ
channel.description: Recent content in Team on LABHDUFRJ

item.title: Bruno José Rodrigues Durães
item.description: Sociologist, professor of Sociology at UFRJ (Department of Sociology/IFCS); Former professor at the Federal University of Recôncavo da Bahia (UFRB) and UNIFAL-MG; Holds a PhD in Social Sciences (Unicamp-2011), a Master’s in Sociology (Unicamp-2006), and a Bachelor’s in Sociology (UFBA-2004); Specializes in Sociology of Work, focusing on themes such as digital labor, informality, Marxist theory, and sociology education.

item.title: Alexandre Barbosa Fraga
item.description: Adjunct Professor at the Department of Sociology at the Institute of Social Sciences of UERJ; Holds a PhD in Sociology from PPGSA/UFRJ.

item.title: Joyce Louback
item.description: Sociologist and professor at the Faculty of Education at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ), in the Department of Education Foundations; Holds a Master’s and PhD in Sociology from the Institute of Social and Political Studies (IESP-UERJ); Focuses on themes related to Brazil’s redemocratization, collective action, peripheral associativism, and sociology of education.

item.title: José Victor Yunes da Cunha
item.description: Undergraduate student in Social Sciences - UFRJ, with applied knowledge in Python programming, data exploratory analysis in R, and statistics (studies conducted at UFRJ’s Actuarial Science); Currently focused on research on Inequality and Big Data, with a strong interest in integrating qualitative and quantitative methodologies.

item.title: Gabriely Silva Fraga
item.description: Undergraduate student in Social Sciences at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ); Volunteer researcher at UFRJ’s Digital Humanities Laboratory (LABHDUFRJ); Also works as a volunteer in the Campo-Cidade Project, developing management and strengthening tools for the MST’s Armazém do Campo.

item.title: Sabrina Lima
item.description: Undergraduate student in Social Sciences at UFRJ and a volunteer researcher at UFRJ’s Digital Humanities Laboratory (LABHDUFRJ); She has taken several complementary courses in sociology and digital humanities, focusing on understanding the reinvention of humanities in the face of technological evolution.

item.title: Renan Aguiar do Nascimento
item.description: Undergraduate student in Social Sciences Teaching at UFRJ, with a focus on the sociology of work, political sociology, and education; Conducted studies on digital informal labor and influencers as new forms of informal work, as well as research on the National Liberation Action during Brazil’s military dictatorship.

item.title: Maria Lúcia Cordeiro
item.description: Undergraduate student in Social Sciences Teaching at UFRJ and a certified Occupational Safety Technician from CEFET-RJ; Participates in UFRJ’s Digital Humanities Laboratory and the ‘Sociology in Play’ extension project; Develops research on the New High School implementation and urban sociabilities.
